ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: how to analyze movies and discuss literature and film on various topics
A good examination of about a dozen prominent war films as well as connected literature samples.
We analyzed several seminal texts and films within the war film genre.
I learned a lot in this class about how film and comparative literature interact to educate and entertain audiences on the topic of War

As someone always interested in film, this class provided excellent insight in how films are created to portray war. All the readings and films were incredibly fascinating, and I felt like our discussions always left me with new insights.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength is the organization of topics and the reading selections (usually). I liked the discussions and the course material. The weakness of this class is Professor Clark's voice. There was always a loud fan noise in the classroom and she had a very soft voice, plus the mask, leading to some discussions where we couldn't hear her.

I enjoyed the course a lot! The workload was super manageable and I enjoyed our weekly discussion, especially on the more modern films. The only weakness I can think of is especially at the beginning of the semester, it was sometimes hard to actually hear the Professor, but this got better over the course of the class.
The seminars were interesting. I thought that some more student-led discourse could benefit the class, but overall it was great.

The reading load is not overbearing
The movies are fantastic
The discussion based seminar is engaging and exciting 

However with wearing a mask during COVId it was almost impossible to hear the professor
In general this course was very strong! The readings were great and not overwhelming and the weekly film screenings fantastic!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I liked the topic and enjoyed the readings. It was a nice break from a lot of the academic heavy readings in my other courses. Always looked forward to the readings and the films.

Yes! I had a fun time taking it. The second half of the class is much better than the first, in my opinion. (Just as the films were more relevant to modern day events). There are only two assignments, so keep that in mind if you're someone that obsesses over grades.
Yes if you're interested in the material and want a low-impact course.
Absolutely! Interesting for film and non film majors alike
I would! I could not stop talking about what we were learning to my suite mates. The material was fascinating without a crushing workload.

extras.title: FILM 429 01/LITR 466 01/RUSS 465 01 - War in Literature and Film
